citation.article-title: Flavobacterium ponti sp. nov., isolated from seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium ponti sp. nov.
Flavobacterium ponti [pon′ti. L. gen. n. ponti (poet. for maris) of the sea, referring to the place that the type strain was isolated].
Cells are Gram-stain-negative, non-flagellated, non-gliding, non-endospore-forming and rod-shaped, 0.3–0.8 μm in diameter and 0.8–5.0 μm in length.
Colonies on MA are circular with regular edges, convex, glistening, smooth, yellow in colour and 0.5–1.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 25 °C.
Anaerobic growth occurs on MA and on MA supplemented with nitrate.
Optimal growth temperature is 25 °C; growth occurs at 10 and 35 °C, but not at 4 or 37 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is between 7.0 and 8.0; growth occurs at pH 5.0, but not at pH 4.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–6 % (w/v) NaCl, with optimum growth in approximately 2.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Mg2+ ions are required for growth.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Casein, DNA, gelatin, starch, tyrosine, and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but aesculin, agar, CM-cellulose, hypoxanthine, urea and xanthine are not.
Acetoin, H2S and indole are not produced.
The major cellular fatty acids (>10 % of the total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 1.
Additional phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain is GSW-R14T (=KCTC 22802T =CCUG 58402T), isolated from seawater of Geoje Island in the South Sea, Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 31.4 mol%.
